definition: lit. to topple the mountains and overturn the seas (idiom); earth-shattering/fig. gigantic/of spectacular significance
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: I could not see the land, only mountains of water all around me.
sentences.chinese: 我沒法看見陸地，我的四周只有排山倒海的浪濤。

sentences.english: Destined to which people, always for you to ride unchecked.
sentences.chinese: 命中註定的哪個人，總會爲你排山倒海破空而來。

definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
impossible to resist (idiom); an irresistible force
vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
